actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Agriculture.

official_title: A bill to amend the provisions of th Perishable Agricultural Commodities Act, 1930, relating to practices in the marketing of perishable agricultural commodities.

summary.text: Provides, under the Perishable Agricultural Commodities Act, that any commission merchant, dealer, or broker who has violated the unfair conduct provisions of such Act may admit the violation and pay a monetary penalty not to exceed $2,000, in lieu of a formal proceeding for the suspension or revocation of his license. (Amends 7 U.S.C. 499 (6)(5))

titles.title: A bill to amend the provisions of th Perishable Agricultural Commodities Act, 1930, relating to practices in the marketing of perishable agricultural commodities.
